pronunciation: IN'FIDEL, [Latin infidelis; in and fidelis; faithful.]

definitions.text:
Infidel
 [Latin infidelis; in and fidelis; faithful.] Unbelieving; disbelieving the inspiration of the Scriptures, or the divine institution of christianity. The infidel writer is a great enemy to society.
One who disbelieves the inspiration of the Scriptures, and the divine origin of christianity.
